data.title: Zeros of Quadratic Equation
data.statement:
Given the coefficients [[a]],[[b]], [[c]] of a quadratic polynomial in the form P(x) = [[a]]x^2 + [[b]]x + [[c]], your goal is to provide the zeros of the polynomial.

Solutions to a quadratic equation P(x) = 0 can be solved using the Quadratic Formula:
x = (-[[b]] - sqrt([[b]]^2 - 4[[a]][[c]])) / 2[[a]]
and
x = (-[[b]] + sqrt([[b]]^2 - 4[[a]][[c]])) / 2[[a]]

testCases.title: Case with One Zero Solution Validator
Case with no Real Solutions Validator

data.constraints:
[[a]] â‰  0, -10 <= [[a]] <= 10
-10 <= [[b]] <= 10
-10 <= [[c]] <= 10
All solutions are integers or terminating decimals.
data.stubGenerator:
read a:int b:int c:int
write answer
data.inputDescription: A line containing three integers [[a]], [[b]], and [[c]], the coefficients in the Quadratic Equation in the form `ax^2 + bx + c = 0`
data.outputDescription:
One line: the zeros of the quadratic polynomial.

If there are two real solutions, you should display the smaller x first, then the larger x.

If there is only one real solution, you should only display it once.

If there are no real solutions, you should display "{{No real solutions}}"

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given the coefficients a,b, c of a quadratic polynomial in the form P(x) = ax^2 + bx + c, your goal is to provide the zeros of the polynomial.

Solutions to a quadratic equation P(x) = 0 can be solved using the Quadratic Formula:
x = (-b - sqrt(b^2 - 4ac)) / 2a
and
x = (-b + sqrt(b^2 - 4ac)) / 2a
Input
A line containing three integers a, b, and c, the coefficients in the Quadratic Equation in the form 
ax^2 + bx + c = 0
Output
One line: the zeros of the quadratic polynomial.

If there are two real solutions, you should display the smaller x first, then the larger x.

If there is only one real solution, you should only display it once.

If there are no real solutions, you should display "No real solutions"
Constraints
a ≠ 0, -10 <= a <= 10
-10 <= b <= 10
-10 <= c <= 10
All solutions are integers or terminating decimals.
Example
Input
2 1 -10
Output
-2.5 2
